definition: to work/(of a machine) to operate/job/work/task/CL:個|个[ge4],份[fen4],項|项[xiang4]
construction/to carry out construction or large-scale repairs
to work a temporary or casual job/(of students) to have a job outside of class time, or during vacation

sentences.english: The water was shut off for several hours while the plumber repaired the pipes.
sentences.chinese: 管子工修理管道时，水的供应中断了几个小时。

sentences.english: The poor quarryman would have no tomb and no hope of an afterlife.
sentences.chinese: 这个可怜的采石工没有坟墓，也不能奢望来世。

sentences.english: He always makes careless mistakes, and he's a pain to work with.
sentences.chinese: 他总犯粗心的错误，跟他一起工怍真是痛苦。

sentences.english: in the cork workshop, the workers fork the pork.
sentences.chinese: 在栓皮厂房，工许多人用叉子叉猪肉。

sentences.english: It was just impossible for him to get into this I-shaped hole.
sentences.chinese: 要他钻进这个“工”字形的洞口，是完全不可能的。

sentences.english: In addition to my classwork I had two jobs.
sentences.chinese: 除了做课堂功课之外，我还打了两份工。

sentences.english: So Huram finished all the work he had undertaken for King Solomon in the temple of the Lord
sentences.chinese: 这样，他为所罗门王作完了耶和华殿的一切工。

sentences.english: CNNGo: How long have you been a plumber?
"I tried temping [temporary work] for a month, " he adds.
sentences.chinese: “我曾试着做过零时工，”他补充说。

sentences.english: Bob was a plumber, and Frank was a cop.
sentences.chinese: 鲍步做水管工，弗兰克做警察。

sentences.english: A job you have done for 16 years. Do you still want to change it.
sentences.chinese: 一份工你打了16年了，你还想换了它吗？

sentences.english: Labor poetry, the words express the country seen their homes destroyed more than the miserable death.
sentences.chinese: 工诗词，其词多表达国破家亡之凄苦。

sentences.english: The little cager still goes after his captain.
sentences.chinese: 小钩工仍然跟踪他的领导。

sentences.english: Having lights invites trick or treaters to come to your door.
sentences.chinese: 有灯光的技巧或处理工邀请来你的门。

sentences.english: One billowy river appeared in front of the Cowhand.
sentences.chinese: 一条惊涛骇浪的河在牧牛工前面出现。

definition: to go to work/to start work
affair/business/matter/to be engaged in/to attend to/by all means
animal hide/leather/to reform/to remove/to expel (from office)
to finish a job on time/to produce the goods
